Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great neighbourhood”
Reviews.Author: Peter3101
Reviews.Content: A small (16 rooms) hotel, but in a unique environment between the great mosques and the sea - surrounded by other small hotels and many restaurants. Our room was quite small but perfectly adequate with good-sized shower room and powerful shower. The room was clean and everything was in good order, although I struggled to understand the point of a small safe that could be locked, but could also be picked up and carried away - as it was not bolted down to anything. The bed was very comfortable and the TV had BBC World, which made a pleasant change from our recent experience in NY where it was difficult to avoid Fox. Breakfast was good if not great. Don't arrive too late or there may be no omelette/scrambled egg left. The star of the hotel is Hamuk, the long-haired cat which looks a bit like a rug and who has eyes of different colours. There is something about Istanbul and cats - as the very many strays appear to be well fed and unafraid of humans.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Sultanahmet in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: georgie081
Reviews.Content: We booked online, through BA, and, when we arrived, the receptionist at Hotel Poem was, at first, brittle and rather off hand. Apparently, BA did not pass on the requests we had made for twin beds. It would not have been a problem and a twin room was eventually found for us but our welcome was not as friendly and warm as it could have been. This was a shame as Hotel Poem has much to offer the tourist looking for a very reasonably priced hotel in Istanbul. The rooms are truly tiny but they were spotlessly clean and the shower was good with masses of hot water. We had clean sheets and towels every day which was great. Breakfast was excellent and was prepared and laid out with considerable care. It is ideally placed in Sultanahmet to visit all the main attractions and access to the tram was easy.Check out the simply wonderful views from the roof terrace and make friends with the gorgeous cat! I'd go there, again, and would ask for a room at the back.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, good value and perfect location. Good breakfasts as well.”
Reviews.Author: Gowerdale1
Reviews.Content: This is not a luxury hotel and a good thing too. I am one of those people who gets thoroughly miserable if I am given things I don't particularly want just so that the hotel can justify fleecing me. As many tripadvisor reviewers have pointed out the prices reflect that this is a no-nonsense, clean and friendly hotel in an extremely convenient location. Our room was really very small. That said, it was clean and tidy. The bathroom worked and it was reasonably quiet at night (although we were slightly disturbed by other guests rolling in in the small hours). The views are good, especially if you look out to sea rather than down to a rather scruffy, rubbishy area down below. The self-service breakfasts were first rate A steaming samovar of tea, bread and simit, a wide choice of delicious and unusual jams, eggs, and (an especially good touch) a mixture of pekmez and tahin that looks rather unappetising but tastes delicious. The cheese, though, was rather disappointing. Surely good fresh white cheese is readily available, so why the rather tired processed cheese? But the rest of the breakfast was so good that this can be overlooked. The service was extremely friendly and helpful. There is a very pretty Van cat that spends most of its time asleep in the reception area. It's name is Pamuk and visitors should note it has the traditional blue and green eyes.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small hotel close to main sites and NOT expensive”
Reviews.Author: Tchumb
Reviews.Content: This small hotel was a pleasure to visit. All the rooms seem to have been recently renovated and whilst some are small they are very adequate for a short visit and as we stayed for a week and extended another week we were upgraded. I had a twin room throughout and my friends (a couple) were given a family room for the second week. A very nice simple breakfast is served and you can help yourself to as much as you want from the buffet. The hotel was well heater in February and all had air conditioning. We were well received with rooms changed daily if wanted. Lots of local restaurants on the doorstep and being on a cul-de-sac this was a quiet hotel. Views over the Bosporus. Bakers and small shops very nearby. Main tourist sites within 5 to 10 minutes walk away. Good local fish restaurant and railway station 200m down from hotel. Tran stop 10 minutes up from hotel. A great location.

Reviews.Title: “Poem Hotel - a charming Boutique hotel at the center of Sultanahmet District”
Reviews.Author: zlahat
Reviews.Content: This unique hotel is conveniently located within walking distance to all major tourist sites in Sultanahmet area. It is only 7 minutes walk from the Sultanahmet Tram stop, so you can easily come to the hotel from Ata Turk Airport by train (change trains at Zeytinburnu station). The views of the Bosphrous from the hotel are amazing. It is well worth it getting up a bit early to take pictures of the sun rise from the roof top. This is a reasonably priced hotel and includes high quality Turkish breakfast. Above all - the staff of this hotel are always friendly and helpful. Amroe gave me great suggestions on places to see, resturants to eat at, and just in general about life in Turkey which was interesting, you can tell how proud he is of his city. I enjoyed my 3-day stay at Poem Hotel at the heart of Sultanahmet and would recommend it whole-heartedly!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: 0151Gill
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel, with excellent location to major sites and good local restaurants. We stayed for 5 nights in twin room Grand Bazaar, room was not the largest but did meet our needs, bathroom was great, good shower and plenty of hot water. Breakfast good, plenty of choice. Helpful staff. My only thing would be if I was being picky noise from street in the early morning, our room was at front of hotel, my advise would be go for a back room if available but if not it wouldn't be a deal breaker for me. Sorry weather not good enough to use the breakfast and roof terraces.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ABaig60763
Reviews.Content: I had a blast staying here. The staff are quite pleasant. The room is just big enough for two. I would come back anytime!

Reviews.Title: “If you are looking for good value for money look no further”
Reviews.Author: gchiappori
Reviews.Content: This small hotel is a little gem within walking distance of the main attractions. It is clean, the staff are helpful and the terrace on the top floor with a lovely view of the Bosphorous where one con enjoy a drink is a big plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: 46Graham3
Reviews.Content: Had a very pleasant experience staying at the Hotel Poem for 7 nights in late October. Small very clean hotel with with friendly and helpful, though not intrusive, staff. Location can not be beat. P.S Loved the cat!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel to recommend”
Reviews.Author: Mehdi_Bas
Reviews.Content: This is a little hotel well located and near to known attractions : 5 minutes walk to Topkapi, AyaSofia, Blue Mosque. The hotel offers a hearty breakfast. Staff polite and helpful. The terasse upstairs is a big plus to watch the blosphore any time.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location in quiet street”
Reviews.Author: chgLondon
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed our stay in this small hotel. We had the 'Listening to Istanbul' room which I would strongly recommend, large with a wonderful view over the Sea of Mamara. Very comfortable and airy hotel with a shady terrace for breakfast or an evening drink. The hotel is very near the local bars and restaurants but down a quiet street so a lot more peaceful than some other places. Very near some of the main sights and on the tram line so it's easy to get to other parts of Istanbul. Staff polite and helpful

Reviews.Title: “Terrible service, good location”
Reviews.Author: Nanapu
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well located in a quiet corner in old city. Walkable distance to any attracts. The terrance for breakfast is lovely. However, the reception is a terrible terrible experience, erasing all the plus from this hotel. There's a young guy, called Mustafa (not sure if it's his real name cause he refused to write his name for us) is the worst receptionist I ever met during my trips anywhere before. 2 small things to share. - The pick-up I booked did not show up when I arrived in Istanble on first day. Mustafa insisted it's not HIS problem. When standing in the front desk, he's representing the hotel not himself, but seems he did not know this at all. Keep arguing with me even when I managed taxi to hotel by myself. Apprecited that he arranged early check-in for me when I finally agreed it's not his personal fault but sth. wrong with the communication. - When left Istanbul for Izmir, we left 2 luggages in their hotel & informed them we'll be back to pick up at very late night on Oct.6th. The front desk even put a note with our name & arrival date on the luggage, making sure there'll be receptionist to take care of this when we're back no matter how late it is. However, the thing did not go smoothly. When we arrived in Istanbul at 23:30 on the 6th, we called poem said we're going over to take our luggages, it is exactly the same guy, Mustafa, took the phone (bad luck), said he's not informed & did not know anything about the luggage at all, so we could not come over at the moment but should wait till 9:00am next day! We said there's a note on the suitcase and we could bring our passports over to identify ourselves. He still insisted he did not know anything about luggage and did not know where the luggages were kept. He did not even try to help at all but wish to get rid off the trouble asap. My friend was really pissed off for his rude attitude on this simple issue. So she asked his name on the phone & said we'll let the manager know this the next day. He's then changed a little bit & agreed us to take the luggage. When arrived in the hotel, it took him 10 seconds to find the luggage, which is just around the corner under the stairs. It did not cost him anything to give back OUR luggage. The worst thing is he still keep argueing with my friend said all he did is to secure our luggage even when we took the luggage at midnight, did not caring the guests were sleeping at the moment! Jesus! And he did reconganized us at his first glance and did not check any identification at all. When we tried to write a comment in the hotel notebook, he even stopped my friend, pushing her away with his elbow! How childish the manner seemed to us. It should have been a nice stay in this small hotel. We love the location & the terrence. But with this rude guy, Mustafa, we will never come back again. and we strongly suggest you do not live with this hotel unless you did not meet this young guy for any communication. Otherwise, he could easily ruin your day.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly situated”
Reviews.Author: Penelope-Jane-P
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely four days in Instanbul in this perfectly situated hotel. This hotel is within easy walking distance of the major sights in this lovely city. The room was comfortable and the breakfast perfect with plenty of fresh fruits, cereals, breads and cheeses. Would recommend this hotel and amazing city to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, some friendly staff, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: MindPig
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is located in an unassuming building on a side street, which I thought was really quaint and charming after walking past all the hostels and tourist restaurants.The staff were either completely indifferent or very friendly, but never rude. One of the men who worked there in the afternoon was especially helpful in reserving me a bus ticket and a taxi for the next morning. Sure I could've done it myself, but that took a load off my jet-lagged mind. It was a bit hard to sleep because of the noise in the area and because my room was right over the breakfast area. The staff started cooking breakfast and shuffling around at about 5 in the morning. I probably could've gotten a different room if I'd asked, but it was no big deal. The hotel is in easy walking distance to the Aya Sofia, Blue Mosque, Topkapi Palace, and plenty of overpriced but good tourist restaurants. Given the area, I don't think there are any negatives that wouldn't be found at other hotels. They also have airport pickup, so my first few days in Turkey were very worry-free. Also good wifi, clean basic rooms with hot water, great air conditioning, and a nice outside area for sitting. I didn't have breakfast there, so can't comment. If I were to return to Istanbul I would likely stay here again. What I would do differently is take the time to find some more traditional Turkish restaurants where the everyday working folks eat, which I did later in my trip to Turkey to amazing and delicious results.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient small hotel”
Reviews.Author: OrlandoAsh
Reviews.Content: Poem is a small , friendly convenient small hotel. It close to all main Istanbul attraction and also close to some of the good restaurants. The rooms are not that big. But for those visits, all you are doing is the night sleep, this is enough. The breakfast is good enough to get you going. The best part of the hotel is , the rooms are very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and Friendly”
Reviews.Author: AngusDiver
Reviews.Content: There was a little hiccup on checking in; we had requested a twin room (for two guys) but only a double was available. This was easily remedied by the staff giving us separate rooms until the following day. The hotel is small however it was well positioned in Sultanahmet only minutes walk from the bars and street cafes but in a quiet little side street. The rooms are comfortable, spotlessly clean and the hotel staff were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, nice roof-terrace, nice staff...VERY small rooms...”
Reviews.Author: EveMSaal
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really nice, the staff is too, the sight from the roof terrace is very nice too...so is the breakfast! Even Internet for no money.... but the room was really really small, 2 girls almost did not know where to put our stuff.... In the end was still worth the money, clean rooms and the area is just more than perfect!!

Reviews.Title: “We will keep coming back”
Reviews.Author: DSwogan
Reviews.Content: Weâ€™ve stayed here on two different occasions, and will definitely come back. Itâ€™s located close to attractions, plenty of restaurants and cafes, but on a quiet side street where itâ€™s easy to relax. The back terrace is great place to enjoy their ample daily breakfast or afternoon tea, and the rooftop has places to sit with views over the water, Blue Mosque, and Hagia Sophia. The friendly staff remains a constant, which is a very good thing.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: annikalibby
Reviews.Content: The Poem Hotel of Istanbul is a hidden gem. In the Old Town district of Sultanahmet, it is located a small sidestreet where noise is kept a minimum, yet is close to the main attractions. The Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, Basilica Cistern, and Topkapi Palace are a quick five minute walk away. The Grand Bazaar is about fifteen minutes away, as is the port of Eminou for a cruise on the Bosphorous. Additionally, the main street just across from the hotel is lined with a dozen or so outdoor cafes for a great supper with a short stroll back to the hotel. With such a great location, the hotel is truly great because of its small â€œboutiqueâ€� feel. The dozen or so rooms are named after various poems (hence the name) rather than being numbered. Breakfast, which was extensive and featured hot items every morning, is served in an adorable greenhouse adjacent to the hotel. There is free internet access, both in wireless for use in the rooms and on a desktop for general guest use in the lobby. The rooms are small, but well equipped with toiletries, soft bedding, minibar, television (with two English channels), air conditioning, and a safe. As for the staff, they were very gracious and accommodating. Overall I have nothing but positive feedback regarding my stay at the Poem Hotel and would suggest booking here. Tip: Try the Sultan Restaurant on the main streetâ€”they have great food at fabulous prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good simple hotel in great locaton in Sultanahmet old city”
Reviews.Author: LondonLorraine
Reviews.Content: I'd booked a double room - it was very clean and well presented but very small. Bed took up nearly all of space. Was there for 4 nights and I might have struggled if I'd had to share it with someone. This was the 'Streets' room. Great shower room. The location is ideal - on a side street in Sultanahmet so very central without being noisy. Staff are very helpful and made calls for me when I needed to sort out some arrangements. Free internet available. There is a terrace but with mixed views. Breakfast is standard Turkish buffet in a conservatory. The Poem is a good place if you want a simple small hotel in great location in Sultanahmet.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed there twice & would stay again”
Reviews.Author: Caanaadaa
Reviews.Content: This is my second review of the Poem. We stayed first in September, and then returned a in late November for about 10 days. Between visits weâ€™ve stayed in about 4 of their rooms â€“ during our second visit the hotel kindly upgraded us to their suite when it was available. The suite was beautiful, large, had a private balcony with a view of the Bospohorus. The other rooms varied in size â€“ one small, one medium, and one a little larger than average. All rooms were clean & well kept. The staff are great. The breakfast Gazebo is nice in any weather. There is also outdoor tables & a rooftop that we you can go up to with your breakfast of for drinks during the day/evening. We liked this hotel a lot and it would be our first choice hotel. It is a small hotel with great staff. I donâ€™t think youâ€™ll find better value for your money. We loved the neigbourhood â€“ we could walk to all the main attractions in the Sultanahmet area.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: jrmwash
Reviews.Content: Very friendly and helpful staff. Adrian knew who we were when we walked into the lobby the first day "You must be...". The hotel is small but right in the heart of Sultanahmet and just a few blocks from all the major sights. Great restaurants a half a block away. Very generous breakfast buffet included in the price. Rooms are quite small in European tradition but very clean. Hotel is on a small alley so there is no through traffic - quiet at night. We will go back next time in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly place in good location”
Reviews.Author: TravelerK16
Reviews.Content: Nice small family hotel within walking distance to many historical sites. Most helpful staff. Great view from the top terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Generally OK, BUT-------”
Reviews.Author: mike_garley
Reviews.Content: I agree with the general view that most people seem to put forward about this hotel - friendly and helpful staff, very conveniently located for the main touris sites in Istanbul and for restaurants in the evening (although possibly less convenient if you are looking for a more active nightlife - which I wasn't) and kept very clean. Drawback however:- 1.I was travelling with my adult son and we had booked a twin bedded room for 4 nights. On arrival we were told that they did not have a twin room for the first night and had little option but to share a double bed - something that did not please either of us. OK, they moved us after one night, but this to me does not say much for their booking efficiency. 2. The rooms are VERY small (the smallest twin room I ever remember encountering). and for anyone with clothes formore than a couple of days it is impossible to unpack because of the shortage of hanging and storage space. 3. Be prepared to run the gauntlet of people trying tosell you a carpet or drag you into a restaurant every time you leave the hotel. Impossible toget anywhere otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “What a view!!!!”
Reviews.Author: norsgade
Reviews.Content: We just spent a wonderful week in Istanbul at Poem Hotel. It was difficult to find - in the small streets of Sultanahmet. But it was worth looking. We had the room "All of a sudden" (called after a turkish poem), and we had the most fantastic view over the Mamaris Sea, Bosperus and Istanbul. The people were very kind and helpfull. Standard fine.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but missed on a few”
Reviews.Author: aannuujj
Reviews.Content: Good stuff - 1) Excellent location. 2) Good value for price, breakfast was included 3) Friendly staff 4) The aiprort shuttle was cheap going out, 5 Euros Not so good - 1) Bathroom had a smell 2) No elevator so if you have a lot of stuff 3) The matresses are very hard! Sleep suffered

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JD1709
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Poem is perfectly located in central Sultanahmet. It sits right between the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sofia - about a 5 minute walk to each, 20 minutes to the Grand Bazaar and 10 minutes to Topkapi Palace. We didn't have a need for public transport our entire trip. Additionally, it sits right in the middle of a restaurant district - less than 2 minutes to a range of restaurants, bars and cafes. The hotel is simply furnished but impeccibly clean. We were in Street room, which was small but plenty for anyone wanting a hotel for a base. However, our room did overlook the road and if I were to go back, I would select a room at the back with a view of the Bosphorus, which would be quieter. There was free internet, a small room service menu (which we didn't use but looked fine) and staff were on hand 24 hours for any queries. All the staff we met were great - really friendly and helpful. As with our room Breakfast was simple but had everything you needed (Eggs, breads, cereals, juices etc) for a day sightseeing. All in all, a great value hotel and I would return for its location alone. Definitely recommended! For first time visitors to istanbul, wanting to be close to sights and entertainment, you could not be located in a better spot. But it would be worth talking to the hotel if room size is going to be a big deal. I am sure there were some bigger rooms than we had - you just need to identify them!

Reviews.Title: “How does it feel to be inside a poem? Enchanted, amazed, satisfied.”
Reviews.Author: Grzdacz
Reviews.Content: It has been said (probably correctly) that Istanbul is the most romantic city in the world (Tariq Swelim, 2004), and Poem Hotel is a perfectly romantic place in the city. A cozy place wher one easily feels at home, especiallly with the genuine friendlienes of the helpful and efficient staff, located just at the edge of the gentrified section of Sultanahmet, in a perfect location for sightseeing on foot and close to public transport to anywhere you might want to go, yet away from the crowds. Istanbul has many wonderful places to stay, but Hotel Poem offers excellent value for your money, plus the special charm that no money could buy. Be aware that there are trade-offs for staying in an authentic historic building: some rooms are extremely tiny. They are not claustrophobic, though, but cheerful, bright, and immaculately clean (this was a great place even before the recent renovation; now it has become even better.) The charming maze of the hotel's steps up and down to the rooms and to the lovely terraces may be dificult to negotiate for elderly or incapacitated guests, even if the friendly staff is happy to help. Also, in this location commanding over the busy waters you will hear the constant murmur of passing ships and boats. I didn't find the sound disturbing or offensive, rather, it is part of the magical location. And then, nothing can beat waking up with the view from above on ships and fishing boats on the Sea of Marmara and at the mouth of the Bosphorus. Barely came back from there and already cannot wait to go to Hotel Poem again.

Reviews.Title: “Listening to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: GringoBob42
Reviews.Content: Very convenient for Sultanamet attractions, clean, well run with courteous English-speaking staff on duty at all times. Our room was small, but clean with view of Bosporus and a very modern bathroom. Breakfast very good in attractive garden room.

Reviews.Title: “Poem Hotel - Like being at home...great location!!!”
Reviews.Author: findjj
Reviews.Content: The Poem Hotel has a lot going for it starting with the Manager, Adnan. He is very kind, informative, and attentive to your every need. The location is perfect as it's just off the main restaurant road yet quiet and peaceful. The breakfast is held in a separate dining area which is very nice. You can also go there during the day to do internet and relax, or you can sit outside or better yet, on the Rooftop Terrace. The views are 360 degrees and amazing! Overall this hotel is a very nice place to stay. There is also a laundry business around the corner so you can drop your stuff off to have it cleaned as well as the best cafe (Cafe Rumorist) in Istanbul for lunch and dinner around the corner. Great foo! It's centrally located, clean new, friendly, informative, and in one word..."homey". if you are looking for a large room than this may not be the place for you. However, the design and decor is great. Again, the hotel is a must for someone on a budget but looking for something nicer without the "backpackers" scene! Enjoy and say hello to Adnan!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, small, convenient and nice”
Reviews.Author: Tripp55
Reviews.Content: Certainly a good value but be ready for little extra room around your bed. We travel light so that was not an issue. The staff was courteous and the included breakfast was always fresh.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and great views”
Reviews.Author: travelbugshannon
Reviews.Content: We've just stayed in the Hotel Poem as part of a British Airways offer. As it was quite reasonable price (300GBP/person for flights from UK and 4 nights B&B) I'd expected it to be fairly basic but we had a really nice room with views out over the Bosphorus across to Uskadar. The bathroom was spotlessly clean with a good shower, and the room had a TV, mini bar and hairdryer and there's free internet in the lobby. The hotel is in a quiet side street but just off Akbiyik Caddesi which has loads of restaurants and it's only a few minutes walk from the Blue Mosque and Aya Sofya. The roof terrace has great views of these floodlit at night. The building itself is one of the traditional wooden houses that can be found in Sultanahmet. The hotel is ideal for anyone on a short break who plans to be out sightseeing most of the time and wants a clean, reasonably priced central hotel but with a bit of character.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, perfect views and excellent, friendly service.”
Reviews.Author: Lazeeza
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, within walking distance to many sites. It has the best view from their beautiful balcony restaurant. The management are very accommodating, friendly, helpful, and make your stay as comfortable as possible. We certainly hope to go back to Istanbul again soon, and if so, we'll stay at the Poem again. Thanks to all the staff!

Reviews.Title: “I recommend the Poem - central, quiet, clean, good staff”
Reviews.Author: Caanaadaa
Reviews.Content: Consistently good service. Main 3 staff you deal with are all positive, helpful & professional. Room was a little bigger than what i expected (nice surprise). Central - in the Sultanahmet area - but off the busiest streets, so quiet. You can walk to all they key attractions. Great rooftop patio - nice spot to sit and watch the water. Breakfast areas are nice (an outside patio or inside gazebo to choose from). If you prefer you can take your breakfast on the rooftop patio. I'd stay there again. But book ahead - they fill up (we could not get in our second time in Istanbul) Warning - like many of the boutique hotels there is no elevator - so if stairs are a problem then ask for a lower floor.

Reviews.Title: “A really nice small hotel”
Reviews.Author: SusanMary27
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice restored Ottaman wooden house with charactor. It is in a nice area which felt very safe. Near to lots of restaurants and walking distance to all the main sights. The rooms are on the small side but very clean, fresh and light. The bathrooms have large showers and modern bathroom suites. The breakfast had plenty of choice eg different breads, boiled eggs, cheese, lovely yogurt, home made jam, cakes, fruit and more. The breakfast could be taken inside or on the terrace. There is also a roof terrace with small bar with views over the sea and Istanbul which was amazing at night. The people who run the hotel are very friendly and helpful. They try to do what they can to make your stay a good one. I hope to go back for another stay. If you need an airport shuttle it is a good idea to get your hotel to recommend or even book it for you.

Reviews.Title: “very good central hotel”
Reviews.Author: damaca
Reviews.Content: The service was excellent, very friendly, and welcoming. The rooms were good, clean and comfortable, but not large.They did not have views, however there were wonderful views from the roof terrace, over the rooftops of old Sultanahmet, including the Blue Mosque and Haghia Sofia. The breakfast was excellent and generous.

Reviews.Title: “Touristy Party Neighboorhood, Rude Managers, Air Conditioner Issues, Lumpy Bed, Great Shower, Good Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Kanadukathan
Reviews.Content: I give this hotel high marks for the following: great water pressure in the shower, plenty of hot water, cleanliness, good breakfast, the night staff was very nice, and the low end service staff--cleaners and servers were very good. On the other hand, my last two nights I got four hours sleep due to all the party's coming from the adjacent youth hostels and clubs--not the hotel's fault of course, but be clear, this is not a quiet neighborhood this time of year, even if the street it is on is less noisy than the ones with restaurants on them. And this was a Sunday night. Thump thump disco beats from the west, and very loud Oriental music from a restaurant to the east. There are also two buildings, the main one and the second. In mine, the second, it was also quite noisy in terms of doors shutting and opening and even normal conversations in the hallway seemed amplified due to the acoustics. So if you are lying in bed falling asleep and someone comes home, their conversations and doors shutting can wake you. Also, if you do stay here, get a room in the back, mine, which faced the street, had lots of street noise early in the a.m. and into all hours every night of the 6 i stayed there. But overall, this neighboorhood, is full of backpacker's hostels, which means young people drinking alcohol into the wee hours on a pretty regular basis; in future i would just find a different neighboorhood with less night life and tourism, since its so easy to get into the old town by tram and even ferry. Another issue was the AC--the remote was faulty, and the first night the night staff person seemed put upon to fix it, and the first time just replaced it with a second broken remote (there is no manual way to operate the AC). So I came home late and tired to another broken remote that was jury rigged with aluminium foil. Finally got a third one that worked, though not too well (have to get up and stand right next to the ac and aim real well to get it to go), after a bit of stress, and in contrast to the great shower, the AC did not work very well at all, with a very weak fan, so the first nights when it wasn't that hot, and i just wanted some neutral air circulation without opening the windows to the voices of the street, it wasn't possible. They should just replace these ancient AC units and get remotes that work. Finally, and this would be the primary reason i wont be back, the managing partner, Adnan, was quite rude for no reason i could think of. My first morning i could not get the door open to the lobby from the back patio, and here again, there is a faulty door handle that you have to fiddle with until its right. So he comes up behind me, and grabs the door handle to open it, i imagine he will graciously let me pass as i am ahead of him, rather, he just rushes thru ahead very brusquely, a la a scene in Faulty Towers. Now, as i try to close the door behind me, i tell him (he is now behind the desk) i am not sure i can close this, and he yells at me in an irritated scolding fashion, "oh just leave it open" all of this with no eye contact and a real annoyed tone. His assistant, whose name i don't remember, the early 40's-ish female. My second day i asked her about the open air spice market that their web site mentions is in front of the hotel on Wednesdays. She well nigh yells at me like I am accusing her of treason, "there is no spice market, where did you get that idea." When i told her its on the web site, but hey no problem if there is none, she yells in a rather shockingly vociferousness tone, "there is nothing on the web site about that...." So when i bring up her web site on the lobby computer just to show her i am not insane (at this point this interaction is so stressful i just want to calm her down ) she says, ohhh, that's really old information, sorry. But the whole interaction was so bizarre, i mean i am quite a gentle soul, so i have no idea what generated that. In my other interactions, such as asking how to get to the bus and what not, I found both this woman and Adnan, impatient, irritable, even aggressive, not at all as described by some folk on this site. By the end of my stay, they had warmed up a tad, but definitely this was a huge minus for me..Especially with a name like "Poem" and with a poem in each room, i expected a staff with a more gentle nature. I believe some of the glowing reviews must be written during off season when this bizarrely tense staff hopefully relaxes, perhaps also by people staying in the "superior" and "deluxe superior" rooms, which i got a look at and they did look lovely. My room was essentially a postage stamp, with an uncomfortable uneven mattress to boot. In a town like Istanbul with hundreds of hotels in the 5 block radius of "Poem" I think one could easily do better, and I also would probably not stay in Sultanhamet again, as its so easy to tram or taxi in to see the blue mosque and topkapi and then retreat to a quieter saner neighboorhood. Finally, about the "view of the city and sea" my room at least had no view of any city other than the street immediately below, though the folks in the opposite hotel roof had a good view into my room. My friend's room, which was in the back had a tiny sliver of view of the Bosphorous, nothing terribly atmospheric. But the back yard view, which on the website is of a lucious garden, is actually a giant vacant yard full of rubbish, garbage, construction debris, and fighting cats. The pictures i have posted are of what you see from the patio dining area. It is actually worse than it looks. And when it rains the whole patio is covered in snails. One got on my shoe un-beknowns to me, and when i got up to my room a heard a crunch. A nauseating exclamation point to an otherwise mixed experience.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, relaxed, friendly and quite”
Reviews.Author: gisi222
Reviews.Content: Hotel Poem was a great place to stay, beautiful views, lovely atmosphere and helpful staff. Situated close to resturants and a short walk to the most amazing sites in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky -in a nice way”
Reviews.Author: ChooksonTour
Reviews.Content: The location of this small boutique hotel is in a quiet area very near the centre of the backpackers hostels. It is ideal for airport connections (less than 50 yard walk) and has a wide choice of restaurants and bars in close proximity. It is ideally suited for visiting the main sights like Topkapi palace or hippodrome. Taxi drivers do not know where it is so do your homework before travelling!! Our twin room was quite small but clean and everything worked. The other rooms appeared to be larger. There is no lift. The rooftop terrace has great views looking over the Bosphorus and old Istanbul. Ideal for chilling out with a cold beer before dinner which tends to eaten late (after 8pm) The breakfast terrace is shaded and needs to be as it overlooks a building site, which the hotel management describe with a sense of humour, "our botanic gardens". The whole atmosphere is very laid back and informal. I reckon that it offers very good value for money. The railway line close by is not a distraction of any note.

Reviews.Title: “Small Budget Traveler's Gem”
Reviews.Author: Mysticdancer
Reviews.Content: Hotel Poem in Istanbul is truly a poem of a hotel. Some reviewers on this site apparently do not understand the charm and quirkiness of European hotels and have given the Poem negative reviews. Yes, it is small but it is clean, safe, comfortable and well run. I was very impressed by the staff, particularly the woman at the front desk who praised me for my poor attempts to speak Turkish. My room overlooked the courtyard and the giant fig tree that shaded the patio. At night, I could see the bats that haunt the Ottoman ruins next door darting about and during the day make friends with the city cats that prowl Istanbul's streets. This hotel is in walking distance of the Blue Mosque, Hagia Sofia, the Cistern, and Topkapi Palace. Less than 1/2 a block away is a well lit street lined with restaurants and backpackers' hang outs. I felt safe wandering the neighborhood alone well after dark. There is a rooftop bar at the Poem with amazing views of the Bosporus and Asian Istanbul. For those who complained about the funny little showers, the Turkish-style breakfasts and the bad coffee (it's bad everywhere in Turkey) get over it. You're not in Kansas anymore and somethings are just part of the travel experience. If you want to stay at the 4 Seasons, it's just around the corner and 10 times the cost per night as the Poem. I say, go there and leave this little gem of a hotel to those who appreciate good service, free internet, and charm. I'll take homey any day over modern, plastic sterility.

Reviews.Title: “Listening to Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: NewYorkCityWildcat
Reviews.Content: This room in Hotel Poem is a walk-up, named for a poem, as are all the rooms. And listen we did -- to the muezzins' and seagulls' cries and the foghorns of boats nearby. If you want to stay in the Sultan Ahmet area, near many attractions, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place at a perfect spot”
Reviews.Author: omit
Reviews.Content: We decided to visit Hotel Poem based on a Lonely Planet recommendation while leaving our shabby hotel booked as part of a package deal at KLM. Before having seen the place, our most important reason to visit the Hotel was for it's location being very near to the Blue Mosque and really in the historic centre of Istanbul. The location is truly perfect, the rooms really nice, clean and comfortable and the staff is very friendly and helpful (even helping with a temporarily booking in a alternative hotel). Especially the "all of a sudden" room is highly recommended with its surprisingly beautiful view (see photo). A hotel we would recommend to any traveller visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, value for money and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Nomad61Coventry
Reviews.Content: Small hotel in a very good location. We had the best room in the hotel with good sea views. People were friendly and very helpful. Lots of stairs so difficult for people with mobility problems bit otherwise fine, Five minute walk to Blue Mosque, Aya Sofya and Topkapi Castle. " minute walkt to lots of nice restaurants, but being just off the main thoroughfare was quite at night. Very good price.

Reviews.Title: “Very welcoming, peaceful oasis perfectly located for major tourist attractions - it lived up to all my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: tunis95
Reviews.Content: The staff were very welcoming and helpful when I arrived in the early afternoon. I sat in the terrace listening to the sound of birds and looking at a beautiful fig tree. It was a great relief after the hustle and bustle of Istanbul and a long journey. My room and bathroom were very clean and modern and had everything I needed including a small safe which was very useful. I really enjoyed my stay there. Breakfast was from 8.30-10.30 and was generous with good bread, various cheeses, olives etc as well as cereals. What could be nicer than to sit overlooking the Sea of Marmara. There were several roof terraces which would have given good views of Sulthanamet. The Blue Mosque is 100m away and the tram about 150m which takes you across the Golden Horn. It is a tourist area so inevitably the restaurants around are geared to tourism but useful for a quick snack. Better to look further afield. I think Hotel Poem is exceptionally pleasant, very good value and quite special. I would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Simple, Clean, Economical, Accommodating and in a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: ODROMOS
Reviews.Content: Poem Hotel, newly renovated, is in a prime location. It is a 10 minute walk, at the most to the main cultural attractions of Istanbul such as Hagia Sofia, The Blue Mosque, The Topkapi Palace, The Arasta Bazzaar, Mosaic Museum and several other museums. This is a simple hotel, no frills yet comfortable and economical and clean. It does not have any beautiful views to think of but the location is on a quiet backstreet near shopping and good restaurants. This hotel is in a suprising quiet location. The Hotel is a short walk also to the Tram that takes you over to Beyoglu and Taksim Square with the use of the Tunul to Taksim, a bustling energized part of Istanbul, where the action is. Taxis are always available , even late into the night. Make sure you have a card for the hotel, and know the address as the taxis had trouble finding the hotel , late at night and many of the taxi drivers.do not know English. It is economical and very clean...and surely a no frills place to stay and enjoy Istanbul. I recommend it highly. Breakfast was simple, tradiitonal and very good and gratis.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful old turkish charm”
Reviews.Author: AmandaMasters
Reviews.Content: a delightful, petite character hotel in old Istanbul. tiny rooms, but comfortable and clean. helpful, knowledgeable staff. beautiful rooftop views of the bosphorus!! easy walking distance to all the sights: blue mosque, topkapi, hagia sofia.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: donjohnNottingham
Reviews.Content: The good part is that Poem Hotel, although close to a main tourist street of restaurants, is actually quite quiet. Finding a quiet hotel location in Istanbul is not easy, particularly if you want to be in the Sultanahmet area, where the majority of the sites are. Staff were helpful, and the rooms where clean. Breakfasts were plain with mainly bread and fruit. The Istanbulis don't make a great deal of the first meal of the day. On the down side this hotel is small, and the room that we had was also quite cramped, although we were using it only for four nights so could cope. All the rooms are named after a (Turkish?) poem, and if there are two people in the party then you might want to steer clear of 'The Dagger'. Quite ok for one. We paid the equivalent of Â£57 a night, which included the flight from London Luton Airport, and I think this represented good value.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Helpful Staff, and a Bargain.”
Reviews.Author: JustPassingThrough63
Reviews.Content: For about a week I had a single room with a view of the Bosphorus. Also spent one night in the Superior Room . The smaller room was very nice and had enough space with a view of the sea. The larger had plenty of room and a private balcony with an unbelievable vista of Istanbul. Selma, Tommy, and Ufuk (I hope I spelled everyone's name correctly) took turns at the front desk and were personable and very helpful.They added a lot to my enjoyable stay. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Hidden gem, a home away from home”
Reviews.Author: CalatorPribeag
Reviews.Content: This little hotel is a hidden gem in the heart of Istanbul! On a quiet street but close to everything, it is professionally run, comfortable and clean, tastefully decorated; I cannot imagine a better location, more friendly and competent staff. It provides free internet access on the hotel's computer in the lobby and, last but not the least, it has an amazing garden (one must see it), where one can relax with a book or otherwise. I spent ten very happy days there; Hotel Poem has become my home away from home, and I would never consider staying anywhere else while visiting Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay in Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: tsueer
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel Poem for three days in June. This was a great hotel to stay. Very good location and very helpful staff. They answered all our questions and helped us about making arrangements for our further tour in Turkey. The breakfast on the terrace was delicious. Our room was a bit small but still enough. And the price was ok. In general this was an excellent stay in Istanbul.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Choice”
Reviews.Author: kvinna00
Reviews.Content: I traveled alone and booked my reservation through a third party site. The hotel was a bit tricky to find, but once I got settled, it ended up being wonderfully located, near to a number of major attractions as well as public transportation, making it very easy to navigate the city. The room, while small, was perfect for me. The hotel, including the rooms, was very well-kept and clean, and the staff is very friendly. The room had a minibar, which I did not use, as well as an in-room safe, which I appreciated. Breakfast was, I believe, included, but I slept in and missed it every morning :) Contrary to some other reviews, I had no issue with outside noise, however I do live in Chicago, so silence all night/morning is close to impossible. I stayed when I arrived in Istanbul for 3 nights, and I liked it so much I booked my last night in Istanbul at this hotel after I had finished touring the country.

Reviews.Title: “Central, basic but adequate”
Reviews.Author: nomad88888
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the hotel was its location. Minutes away the Blue Mosque. The rooms however are extremely small and exceedingly basic so don't expect much in this respect. The breakfast was adequate. I would recommend the hotel to friends due to its central location and overall it is ok for the price. One thing to note is that if your flight gets in in the wee hours of the morning, don't expect a very warm welcome. I turned up with friends and luggage in tow at 4am having come straight from the airport and was greeted gruffily saying that check in isn't until 11am or something whereas we had indicated in our emails taht we would need a very early check in. They managed to find me a room but my other two friends had to wait 'til later and crashed in my room in the meantime. Staff warmed up somewhat after the initial sulky greeting.

Reviews.Title: “Senang di Poem, Istanbul”
Reviews.Author: kelinci
Reviews.Content: The 4 days ( june 09 ) we spent in Istanbul and stayed in the hotel Poem were very, very pleasant. It was surprising that the location was so calm ( although most of the rooms are quite small ) and so near the highlights of the europian part of Istanbul, like the Blue Mosk, the Topkapi etc. The complete staff was very nice to us. Thanks for the special attention. Ineke en Bert from Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Charming and reasonable boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Providencia
Reviews.Content: Well located in Sultanahmet for main historical attractions of Istanbul. Topkapi Palace, Haghia Sophia and the Blue Mosque are only five minutes away. This hotel is clean and well managed. The rooms are well maintained and have very good plumbing. It is tucked away in a quiet street but a lot of restaurants are only one minute away. Breakfast (Turkish, German and American options) is served on terrace under a lovely fig three. Some rooms have view towards the Bosphorus/Sea of Marmara. Free internet.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, but make sure you get the right room”
Reviews.Author: jgalovich
Reviews.Content: Wonderfully helpful staff, beautiful garden and nice roof top terrace. Lots of stairs, so if you have mobility issues, this is not the place for you. Excellent braekfast.. Our only problem is that we had booked and paid for a double room but found out later that the room we were given was a single room. Still trying to straighten that out.Location is excellent for tourism, but rather noisy with lots of twenty-somethings around.

Reviews.Title: “A So So Hotel, Not That Great.”
Reviews.Author: GeordieJanice
Reviews.Content: The best thing about the hotel was it's location. It was in the heart of the city and a very short walk to The Blue Mosque and the main attractions. It is in a quiet street just off a main street full of lovely restaurants and a few bars. It was lovely to be woken up in the early morning with the call to prayer. The hotel has 2 seperate buildings. The main building with the reception area then across a walkway a second ajoining building with more bedrooms. The reception area is nice and cosy but not the staff or the welcome. Staff often ignored us and only spoke to us when they had to. The only exception to this was the guy who looked after the breakfast room who was polite, kind and gave faultless service. It was also in stark contrast to the local people who could not have been more helpful and friendly. On the recommendation of staff I walked quite some disance to visit what they called one of the best and most important mosques in the city only to find it closed and half way through a massive long-term renovation programme, surely they knew about this before they sent me off to visit it. There is a roof terrace but it looked bare and neglected. The hotel across the road looked much nicer and their roof terrace looked fantastic. Breakfast was continental, yummy and plenty of it. I gained several pounds on the breakfasts alone! My bedroom & bathroom were tiny. I barely had any floor space to walk in and the minibar doubled as my bedside table as there was so little room. The bathroom was that small I virtually had to step into the shower in order to close the door and I had to squeeze passed the loo to use the shower. It was very uncomfortable. My friend had a room in the other building and his room was much bigger and although his bathroom wasn't that much bigger the layout made it much better to access and use. The walls are paper thin and I struggled to sleep the first night due to the snoring of the person in the next room, thank goodness they checked out the next morning! I did have my doubts about this hotel and went on to their website for reassurance however what you see on their website is not what you get. The photos on the website must be years old as it does not remotely resemble the hotel as it it now. The small rooms and unfriendly staff would make me think twice about returning to this hotel although I would definitely stay in that area again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here - Cheap, Clean, Convenient And Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Playfairest
Reviews.Content: A great little hotel - very reasonable and good service. Clean rooms, friendly staff and good location. I enjoyed a great stay with no problems - wifi was good, room nice, bathroom compact but fine. The only thing I would say against it is the departing cruise ships sound their horns early in the morning and might wake you up but that's the price of being near the sea. Breakfast is served in a nice conservatory and everyone is very helpful. I will be coming back. The rooms aren't big but who comes to Istanbul only for the hotel room!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic place”
Reviews.Author: Shawlandstraveller
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I visited Hotelpoem in November 2008 and we enjoyed every moment of our stay here. The location is fantastic. It is slap bang in the Sultanahmet area of Istanbul and you can get to the Blue Mosque, the Aya Sofia and the nearby tram stop in just five minutes. The staff were extremely helpful. They're local and offer impartial advice about sights, restaurants, day trips and the like. Don't make the mistake of thinking that one of the guys on duty isn't nice. He's quiet and shy - but will still bend over backwards to help you out. The hotel is also very peaceful and restful. It has gardens which look out onto the Sea of Marmaris - it's an ideal spot to have a beer at the end of a busy day sightseeing and dealing with the banter of Istanbulli businessmen! We didn't have any quibbles with the size of our room. It certainly was on the small side. But it didn't bother us so much - we don't have kids and we travel light. But I can understand why some people might get wound up about it.

Reviews.Title: “One of the very best for the money in Sultanahmet.”
Reviews.Author: bisshkek03
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in three boutique hotels in the area and Hotel Poem is the one we have already booked for this summer. Certainly there are fancier hotels but none have better service or more friendly faces. I especially like the fact that the hotel is a bit away from the bustle and noise of Sultanahmet and yet right in the heart of everything. The basic rooms are quite small and the bathrooms in the smaller rooms little more than closets, but then they are small in the other boutique hotels as well. The breakfast is fresh and while the variety is not terribly wide, (about the same as other hotels of its size in the area), it is plentiful and one can relax in the lovely glassed in porch and drink tea while eating fresh pastry for as long as desired. It was cold and rainy during our stay, and we sat in the breakfast room for more than two hours, drinking coffee and glass upon glass of tea. Never once did I feel as if I was being rushed to hurry and finish. The hotel is less than a five minute walk to all the major sites and the view from the rooftop is stunning. The Bosporus is one of my favorite bodies of water and to sit and sip wine on the balcony of a room or the rooftop is a pleasure to be savored. I cannot speak too highly of the friendliness of the staff. We truly felt at home and at ease the three days and nights we were there. In short, there are more elaborate (and expensive) hotels in the area, but none with more caring staff. The hotel was booked while we were there, even in winter, and still the staff were attentive. An extra added attraction is the bread bakery doors away. The smells from there in the morning warm the soul on even the coldest winter day. If you are looking for a bargain and yet want to enjoy the flavor and experience of Ottoman Boutique hotels, the Hotel Poem may be just what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this hotel. This is not 3 star”
Reviews.Author: ssshhh_uk2002
Reviews.Content: Extremely small rooms which look nothing like the photos on their site. The facilities are poor and the bathroom was falling apart. The breakfast was also very poor. Stay away from this hotel if you want a 3 star hotel. This is most probably a 2 star hotel. The only positive is its location near the blue mosque.

Reviews.Title: “Dinky delight”
Reviews.Author: victoriajanejones
Reviews.Content: A wonderfully central location that truly feels like home. The romantic historical delights of Sultanahmet are all around you and yet you have a quiet, comfortable and friendly place to retreat to just around the corner. Great for connecting with the cheap and efficient tram service as well. Very friendly and helpful staff and great views over the Bosphorous as well. Very good value too.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very friendly, almost exactly what I wanted”
Reviews.Author: Gilmann
Reviews.Content: Great value for the money. Stayed here for four nights. It's a slightly downscale European style tourist class hotel, and was almost exactly what I was looking for. Stellar location in Sultanahmet, maybe 4 minute walk to Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque, and tons of restaurants and cafes right out the door. Rooms are small but usable...the room we had was a tight fit with our luggage but it worked. Our room overlooked the sea (although through a tree). Breakfast is simple and tasty; it was included. Cererals, fresh bread (bakery is all of four doors away!), cheeses, jellies, cereals, olives, hard boiled eggs, and a slightly sweet cake. And plenty of coffee or tea and juice. Nice breakfast room and great patio for eating. The ensuite bathroom was clean but in need of fresh paint. Has a fan (but toilet fill-up was slow and quite noisy. Don't know why I mention this....but somehow it seems relevant at the moment. Tons of hot water. Oh and did I mention FREE wireless internet? (After spending $20/day at the last hotel I stayed at, this was really nice). They also have a computer to use in the lobby if you wish.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel in high price”
Reviews.Author: OraT
Reviews.Content: I ordered 2 rooms for 5 night one and a half month before my visit. the price was 80 euro each! we got one nice room and the other was so small that we had no room to put our bags. Not to mention that we ordered a room with a double bed and sea view and got non of them even i had the hotel conformation for all the above. the breakfast was dull and no one of the stuff really interested in his Job. Terrible hotel in high price.

Reviews.Title: “Very happy here”
Reviews.Author: ELear
Reviews.Content: I was very happy at the Poem Hotel. The best things were a) my room, which was quite big, with a view out through the trees over the Bosphorus, and very quiet, b) breakfast on the terrace, which also overlooks the Bosphorus, where one can spend hours and hours drinking good tea, c) the staff, especially the owner, who is extraordinarly helpful, and d) the location, within a few hundred yards of everything that a tourist like myself would normally want to see, such as Topkapi, Hagia Sophia and the Blue Mosque. I booked through Venere.com, and sent an email confirming that I was coming a day or two before.

Reviews.Title: “Just like home, but better”
Reviews.Author: Globe-Jotter
Reviews.Content: Possibly the best location in all of Istanbul if you plan to hit the big sites and seek breathtaking convenience. A sweet, small boutique hotel, hugged with trees and shade at its outdoor terrace, where free full breakfast is served. Free Internet. Cozy (yes, small) rooms, but clean, classy, all the amenities you want and need. Love that the rooms aren't numbered, but rather give the title of a famous Turkish poem, which the lovely, always smiling and helpful (and very good English-speaking) staff will print out for your keeping. Surrounded by mini-markets, restaurants and a stones throw from the famous and equally hospitable Cheers Bar and Just Bar. Feels like a small neighborhood in Paris. Plus: a quiet bakery next door. Want a HOT baguette straight out of the oven at midnight for 40 US cents? There you go. I stayed here for 12 days, and adored it. The owner is a funny, kind man, who makes your stay warm. I really don't know how anybody could have a disagreeable experience with the staff (OK, there was one guy who worked the late shift who could get impatient, but largely he was cool and always pulled through). Location -- amazing. Rooms -- just fine (nice LCD TVs on the wall!). Convenience -- an 11 rating. And prices utterly reasonable. I'm going back in the fall.

Reviews.Title: “Okay, but could be so much better”
Reviews.Author: Fastflight
Reviews.Content: On the plus side, the Hotel Poem is located in a quiet part of Sultanahmet just off the busy Akbiyik Caddesi. We were concerned at first that the noise from the main street would keep us awake but our fears were unfounded. There is also a delightful garden terrace on the ground floor where you can take breakfast in the relative cool of the morning. Breakfast is the same every day but the quality is good. On the minus side, I would describe the Poem as a B&B really. There's no bar or facilities for meals and the roof terrace looks rather neglected - I didn't see anyone up there during our stay. We had a triple room called Copper Age which overlooks the garden terrace. It was pretty cramped for three people and I wouldn't want to stay there for more than a week. That said, it was clean with a reasonable sized bathroom with a good shower. There was also satellite TV, minibar and the air conditioning system in the bedroom was very efficient. The staff were reasonably friendly ( there was a very nice German-speaking room maid) and the lady receptionist helped arrange our visit to the Selimiye Barracks in Uskudar. My overall impression however was that the staff were bored and lacked much motivation. I don't know who owns the hotel but I think that much more could be made of it. It feels like the owners have simply lost interest. If visiting Istanbul for a short stay of maybe three to four nights then quiet location and generally adequate standards of the Poem makes it good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: TaviaC
Reviews.Content: My friend and I recently stayed in Hotel Poem, and we were not impressed! Firstly, when we arrived at just gone midnight, we were told that they had made a mistake and had let our room for the night. This was despite the fact that we had contacted the hotel that morning before we left home to conform our booking! They then said that it was ok because they had arranged for us to stay at another hotel and that they would pay for a taxi to take us to it. However, the taxi driver took us to the wrong hotel, and we ended up having to walk to the other hotel - with our luggage - in the middle of the night. When we complained about this and asked for a reduction as means of compensation, we were refused, and told that at least we didnâ€™t have to sleep on the street! We also later found out that they appear to â€˜double bookâ€™ on a regular basis, and they had done so to another lady who arrived midday as we were leaving. Secondly the room was tiny! We stayed in a twin room which was only really big enough to be a single, and only one of us could stand up at a time! Thirdly we found the hotel staff (with the exception of the cleaners) to be unfriendly and unhelpful on the whole. One of the staff even refused to order us a taxi to go to a fish restaurant (by the fish market) that I had visited before, and argued with me when I said it was much cheaper and better than the restaurants on the Bosphus Bridge (which I was scammed at the year before). I have travelled to Turkey many times and I can honestly say that in the past I have always found the Turkish people to be very helpful and friendly; this is the worst treatment that I have had in any hotel there. Istanbul is a fabulous city with many good hotels, often at very reasonable prices; unfortunately Hotel Poem is not one of these. My advice is to look around for deals and stay somewhere else. I can however recommend Hotel Artefes round the corner, where I stayed last year, which has much better rooms, service and very helpful and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: SheffieldKate
Reviews.Content: Having read earlier reviews we booked War & Lovers, which has a fabulous view. (though you need to be agile to get in and out of the bath!) Unfortunately we had to spend the first night in a really tiny room called Sunday. Location is absolutely ideal and very peaceful, breakfast on the terrace is lovely - not much choice but very good bread (perhaps from that bakery round the corner - there's a wonderful smell every time you walk past). It was my first visit to Istanbul and I loved it. For a good meal with fantastic views go to the restaurant on top of the Storks building at Eminonou, near Galata Bridge - you can't miss it. It's a fabulous spot and the staff are great. Also make sure you have lunch at Konyali restaurant in grounds of Topkapi - another beautfiul spot. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spring Break”
Reviews.Author: jaygopen
Reviews.Content: Just back for an excellent stay in the Poem - Istanbul in April is a lovely place to be! While - as many reviewers note - our room was on the small side - it was spotlessly clean , and the comfy bed, decent shower and (perhaps most of all) the view over the Sea of Marmara compensated - the room is only a place to sleep after all! The rest of the hotel was very nice : Good sound Turkish breakfast - great bread, olives and cheese, brilliant crisp cucumber and plenty coffee! Helpful and friendly staff, and genuinely cracking views from the roof terrace. It is very close to all the major attractions, but in a quiet cul-de-sac with no through traffic. A little early morning noise from the nearby railway line, but nothing to disturb your rest much. It worked for us - when I return to Istanbul I'll probably book there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: Xiphias
Reviews.Content: What makes this hotel exceptional is the helpful owner (Adnan). He is a wealth of information. His staff is also helpful. The hotel is well situated, walking distance to the major sites. Rooms often have a wonderful view. The rooms are nice, quiet, not incredible. Breakfast is on par with other hotels we stayed at in Turkey -- a pretty good buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Small packages are not always the nicest...”
Reviews.Author: RatleySpencecroft
Reviews.Content: stayed at the Poem for 5 nights...have to say that I was disappointed with our room (NOT featured on their website!) , I would describe it as a single with two beds; possibly ok for a couple of children not for two adults; with no compensatory view of the sea. We asked but no alternative was available.That said, the room was clean and warm, the beds were comfortable and the bathroom was operational. The roof terrace is a super place to view the ships coming up the Bosphorus and the breakfast in the conservartory had an adequate selection (no meat, obviously), and lashings of hot tea- a bigger choice of fruit would have been welcome. The location is ideal for seeing the major sites and the street is mostly quiet (except for bread vans picking up from the bakers). I would recommend this hotel only if you can be assured of having a `suiteÂ´.

Reviews.Title: “very comfortable”
Reviews.Author: artform
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel. Pick up from the airport was great. (for a fee) we arrived to the hotel and was shown to our room (gypsy) which was rather small and the window looked out to the eating area.,a little to close for comfort. Always kept the curton closed Front desk was occasionally helpful. The location can't be beat.. The room is clean and breakfast included. good resteraunts near by and all the tourist attractions walking distance away.

Reviews.Title: “Location ,Location ,Location”
Reviews.Author: Harry321
Reviews.Content: Excelent location ,most places to visit are walking distance ,friendly staff , free wireless internet connection on the top room ,fabulous views & delicious breakfasts We will be back

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Atmosphere, some Ripping Off...”
Reviews.Author: bkcarolina
Reviews.Content: Perfect location a couple blocks behind the Blue Mosque, friendly and helpful employees, and the place has a lot of charm. Good breakfast, nice room and very clean (though small). Only problems were that they tried to rip me off when I called for the reservation (quoting prices even higher then their own website gave), but bargained a bit when I resisted. In the end I reserved for a much lower price on hotels.com, even with paying a surcharge to that website. This is typical of hotels in Istanbul, though. DO NOT make phone calls from your room. I asked about the charges but was told by the desk clerk he had no way to know, that it would all appear on the bill. It did, and it was NOT cheap, or even reasonable. Nice is that there is 24 hour access, the free wireless internet access worked reasonably well from the room (and very well from the lobby), and, as I said before, the breakfast was decent. Cleaning staff and all staff were friendly, helpful, efficient.

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: cmh_travlr
Reviews.Content: Poem is in a great area if you're planning to take on many sights by foot. The rooms were clean and the bed was comfortable. The highlight of our stay here was the excellent Turkish breakfast each morning. Very fresh and always well-stocked. While the hotel management didnt go to great lengths to impress us, the fact is, they run their hotel well. (I would encourage them to not solicit positive feedback from their guests -- many would do so anyway). Overall, I would highly recommend if you're looking for a charming boutique hotel in a fantastic location with excellent breakfast. Would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A bit overpriced”
Reviews.Author: Will-O-TW
Reviews.Content: We visited Poem Hotel in early December so my review relates to a winter visit. Pros: -Very clean and well-heated. -Nice building (though the reception room is a bit disappointing). -Average or better breakfast in a very pleasant greenhouse. -Spacious bathroom, nicely decorated and in excellent condition. (we had a bathtub but I think most rooms have shower). -Very friendly staff. -It's situated in a quiet alley very close to Topkapi entrance (it could be noisy in the summer). Cons -Very small, low-ceiling, low-lit rooms with small windows plainly decorated (we had no problem with that as we spent most of the day outside). -very touristic neighbourhood (that can be a advantage because you are close to all the major sights) -No extra comforts (TV, minibar/fridge, internet connection in room) -high-cost for these accommodations. For over 50 euros/night for a low-season vacation one can find several alternatives in Sultanahmet with Sat TV and especially a mini-fridge which can be necessary during summertime. In conclusion, Poem Hotel is a decent choice that would be an excellent one for a lower price (I think it is negotiable). The pictures af the "All of a Sudden" room can be misleading about the condition of the rest of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem”
Reviews.Author: WilliamsburgWilly
Reviews.Content: I was attracted to the Poem by the rate I got ($51/night), the location and reviews I read on line. I was expecting an average two-star hotel, more like a pension or hostel, but The Poem is several cuts above that. Its major pluses, apart from the price and location (the latter is perfect: right in the Sultanahmet hotel district, but on a dead-end side street with no traffic, a 5-min. walk to the Topkapi, Aya Sofya, Blue Mosque and with shops and restaurants all around), are the wonderfully cooperative (and English-speaking) staff, the buffet breakfast served on the garden patio, the rooftop terrace with amazing views out over the rooftops to the Sea of Marmara and of the Blue Mosque, and 24/7 free fast Internet service from a comfortable work station in the reception area. I stayed in two different rooms and they were both quite small (and the bathrooms even smaller with only a hand-held wand shower) but I was only there to sleep. If I wanted to read or have a drink I would go up to the roof. I would definitely stay at The Poem again. It made my first visit to Istanbul even more memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time here”
Reviews.Author: northropfrye
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Poem Hotel for seven nights and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. The staff was very helpful and the room had a stunning view of the Sea of Marmara. It's in a great location, just a block away from Topkapi Palace, the Blue Mosque and Hagia Sophia. I would have no hesitation staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great little hotel”
Reviews.Author: djl27
Reviews.Content: A lovely little hotel in an excellent positin at a reasonable price. It really is as near everything as they suggest. We asked for and got a room with a great view of the Sea of Marmara and the constant stream of boats heading to and from the Bosphorus. And an intrigueing roofscape. If you want this view ask for Listening to Istanbul (the room name â€“ they don't have numbers). Staff very pleasant and everything very clean. Atmosphere relaxed, A bit noisy â€“ close to train line â€“ but not a problem, and nothing compared to the first call to prayer of the day at about 5:30. Breakfast ok, but not particularly noteworthy.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in a quiet location”
Reviews.Author: Seb12345
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 nights at the hotel Poem in Istanbul in April 07. The location is perfect, less than 5 minutes walk from all the sights like Aya Sofia and the blue mosque. The rooms are fairly small but nice and clean, most of them with great views of the sea. The staff is very friendly and speaks good english. I definitively recommend this place if you are looking for a quiet, affordable hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “very impressed”
Reviews.Author: LondonBusinessman
Reviews.Content: Having read some negative reviews on this website we were sceptical about this hotel. However, it was cheap and seemed to be in the right location so we went with the positive reviews and ignored the bad ones. We were very surprised - the room was exceptionally clean, modern, OK it was a bit small but the beds were very comfortable, it had tv with satellite channels, the shower pressure was great, really nice hot water. The reception has free internet access, and the staff can't do enough for you. The breakfast was basic but again adequate to set you up for the morning. Tea, coffee, fruit juices, fresh bread, jams, cheeses, yoghurt and fruit. Would I recommend this hotel? Absolutely. Comfy beds, helpful staff, great location. I would also recommend the turkish bath that arranges pickup from and transfer to the hotel, plus the half day city tour that also picks you up and drops you off.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Tony3357
Reviews.Content: Booked a twin room (for two single people) - and the room was desperately small, really not big enough. And dark. Shower room (not what you'd call a bathroom) was inadequate. The staff were very friendly and helpful, though, and the location excellent. But in the end we checked out and found another, better, hotel for the same price, and in the same area..

Reviews.Title: “poetic licence”
Reviews.Author: dode&mo
Reviews.Content: We had four nights in the Poem. We were fortunate enough to have 'all of a sudden' room for the first two nights. We were gobsmacked by the view from our private balcony, over the sea of marmaris to the asian side of the city. We couldnt wait for daylight to see what the city had to offer. After a great nights sleep in a comfy bed the shower first thing in the morning was fantastic, loads of water pressure... but be careful getting out of the shower if you are unsure on your feet. Breakfast was adequate but the 'nescafe' coffee was dissappointing (which we found to be the case in most of Istanbul). The staff were very helpful and the location was fantastic... the views from the terrace took your breath away, although the decor was uninspiring. The second two nights of our stay we were moved to a room on the lower level overlooking the street which was much smaller and more basic. We were perhaps spoiled by 'all of a sudden' but the rooms were both very clean and the air-con was most effective. All in all a terrific budget hotel in an amazing location which we would not hesitate to recommend. We suggest you book direct through the poem hotel website and ask for 'all of a sudden' room. The reason we had only 2 nights in this room was because of returning guests who stayed at the poem a few times before, and its nice to see customer loyalty being rewarded. The main drag outside the hotel has great bars and 'kosk' restaurant on the corner was a wee gem.

Reviews.Title: “A diamond in the dust!”
Reviews.Author: clarabelleno1
Reviews.Content: A perfect location right in the heart of old Istanbul The staff were so friendly and helpful and breakfast out on the patio every morning in the glorious sunshine was a treat! What a truly lovely place - our best holiday ever!
